label: 寺内町
本: Osaka: The Merchants' Capital of Early Modern Japan . Cornell University Press . 1999
著者: McClain, James L.  and Wakita Osamu
見出し読み: じないちょう, じないまち
説明文: Literally, a town within the precincts of a temple; a phenomenon of the Muromachi period (1333-1568) when many temple towns associated with the True Pure Land sect acquired extensive self-governing powers and became important centers of commerce and trade; also glossed as jinaimachi
